1:
God, you are the one whom I praise,\q1 so please answer my prayer
\q1
2:
because wicked people slander me\q2 and tell lies about me.
\q1
3:
They are constantly saying that they hate me,\q1 and they harm me for no reason.


\q1
4:
I show them that I love them\q1 and that I pray for them,
\q2 but instead of being kind to me, they say that I have done evil things.
\q1
5:
In return for my doing good things for them and loving them,\q2 they do evil things to me and hate me.



\q1
6:
So appoint a wicked judge who will judge my enemy,\q1 and bring in one of his enemies who will stand up and accuse him.
\q1
7:
When the trial ends,\q2 cause the judge to declare that he is guilty
\q2 and cause even his plea for mercy to be considered a sin.


\q1
8:
Then cause him to die soon;\q2 bring someone else to take over his work.
\q1
9:
Cause his children not to have a father anymore,\q2 and cause his wife to become a widow.
\q1
10:
Cause his children to leave the ruined homes that they have been living in\q2 and to wander around begging for food.


\q1
11:
Cause all the people to whom he owed money to seize his property;\q2 cause strangers to take away everything that he worked to acquire.
\q1
12:
Make sure that no one acts with any loyalty toward his memory for the sake of your covenant;\q2 make sure that no one pities his children.
\q1
13:
Cause all his children to die,\q2 so that no one will live to carry on his name.


\q1
14:
Yahweh, remember and do not forgive his ancestors for the evil things that they did,\q2 and do not even forgive the sins that his mother committed.
\q1
15:
Think about his sins continually,\q2 but cause everyone living to completely forget who he was.
\q1
16:
I pray these things because that man, my enemy, never acted toward anyone as your covenant says we must;\q2 he persecuted poor and needy people
\q2 and even killed helpless people.


\q1
17:
He liked to curse people.\q2 So those terrible things that he requested to happen to othersâ€”cause them to happen to him!
\q1 He did not want to bless others,
\q2 so make sure that no one blesses him!
\q1
18:
He often cursed other people, also;\q2 cause the terrible things that he wanted to happen to others to happen to him and enter his body as water does,
\q2 as olive oil soaks into a person's bones when it is rubbed on his skin.


\q1
19:
Cause those terrible things to cling to him like his clothes\q1 and be around him like the belt that he wears every day.
\q1
20:
Yahweh, I wish that you will punish all my enemies that way,\q2 those who say evil things about me.



\q1
21:
But Yahweh, my God, do good things for me\q2 in order that I may honor you;
\q1 rescue me from my enemies
\q2 because you faithfully love me as you promised.
\q1
22:
I request you to do this because I am poor and needy\q2 and my inner being is full of pain.
\q1
23:
I think that my time to remain alive is as short\q2 as an evening shadow that will soon disappear.
\q2 I will be blown away as a locust is blown by the wind.


\q1
24:
My knees are weak because I have fasted very often,\q2 and my body has become very thin.
\q1
25:
The people who accuse me make fun of me;\q2 when they see me, they insult me by shaking their heads at me.


\q1
26:
Yahweh, my God, help me!\q1 Because you faithfully love me, rescue me!
\q1
27:
When you save me,\q2 cause my enemies to know that you are the one who has done it!


\q1
28:
They may curse me, but I ask that you bless me.\q2 Cause those who persecute me to be defeated and disgraced,
\q1 but cause me to be glad!
\q1
29:
Cause those who accuse me to be completely disgraced;\q2 cause other people to see that they are disgraced as easily as they see the clothes that they wear!



\q1
30:
But I will thank Yahweh very much;\q2 I will praise him when I am among the crowd of people who are worshiping him.
\q1
31: I will do that because he defends poor people like me\q2 and because he saves us from those who have said that we must die.
